instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-2879 - PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground
threads.message:
i have a 820-2879 that customer used someone elses charger, and there was damage on Q7080 & F6905, PPBUS_G3H shorted to ground,
i injected power, and found the short, but the short went away partially, then injected power again at another point where PPBUS_G3H was still shorted, and it heated else where, removed that, and it seems to keep going,
PPBUS_G3H does not find the actual short, just partially, is this a dead board?

threads.title: 820-2879 - PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground
threads.message:
Could be, if you inject voltage without minimal precautions!
NEVER ever inject voltage on PPBUS_G3H before checking for shorted high-side MOSFETs.
If not you may inject high voltage on the PCH, or CPU.

Which is the actual value of that "short".
What did you find and removed from board untill now?

threads.title: 820-2879 - PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground
threads.message:
so far C7280, U7840, C7330, and that all, but ppbus_g3h is still shorted

Diode mode 0.035

threads.title: 820-2879 - PPBUS_G3H Shorted to ground
threads.message: Any big coil with similar value?
